column4: Does 64bit Ubuntu have the same 32bit compatibility layer as windows?
not the same sort of animal.
i use 64bit system here.. works great.. no issues other then a very few apps not having 64bit versions for one reason or another. (i can name 1 app thats not 64bit compat)
if you got 4+GB ram you will want 64bit.. otherwise.. try it.. or not..
Yeah got 12Gb of ram so will do! I have wubi install so need to remove and get x64.
wubi is  best avoided like the plague. :)
why bother? :) if you want to test linux out with windows.. use virtualbox.. much safer, and easier
I have a tone of spare HDD but would only use them if i can get the ZFS working.
I thought u would have a serious reason.
hang out in here long enough and see the dozen+ people in a here a week with wubi issues.. and you will want to avoide it also.
Are there any laptop PCI-E intel wireless N card Drivers for Ubuntu?
it all depends on the chipset of the card i imagine.  wireless works in all 3 of my laptops.
I have wireless but just wanted to know if there are any intel drivers available for ubuntu!
from what i gather most intel stuff works very well.
you would have to check the specifci card/chipset and see how well its supported.
